metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5949 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
VideoLAN VLC media player 2.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted 3GP file, which triggers the freeing of arbitrary pointers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.2.2-5
libvlccore8 - 2.2.2-5
vlc - 2.2.2-5
vlc-data - 2.2.2-5
vlc-nox - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.2.2-5
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.2.2-5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in trusty and earlier is different, and reproducer doesn't work.

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-5').
